source: Columbus & Central Ohio Regional MLS via Columbus REALTORS

westerville.name: Westerville
westerville.notes: Homes go pending in ~3 days. Strong buyer demand with 72% staying local.

columbus.name: Columbus
columbus.notes: Wide price variation by neighborhood. Intel chip plant driving future demand.

dublin.name: Dublin
dublin.notes: Somewhat competitive market. Strong school district demand. 56% price increase since 2020.

gahanna.name: Gahanna
gahanna.notes: Homes go pending in ~4 days. Popular with families. Creekside development adds appeal.

powell.name: Powell
powell.notes: Olentangy schools drive demand. Strong appreciation year-over-year.

new-albany.name: New Albany
new-albany.notes: Most expensive suburb in Central Ohio. Planned community with luxury amenities.

hilliard.name: Hilliard
hilliard.notes: Fast-selling market. Strong school district appeal.

delaware.name: Delaware
delaware.notes: Growing area with new construction. Mix of rural and suburban living.

_updateInstructions.frequency: Monthly, around the 20th when Columbus REALTORS releases new data
steps: 1. Visit Columbus REALTORS housing reports page (or use web search if blocked)
2. Download the latest monthly report PDF or gather data from search results
3. Update 'lastUpdated' to today's date and 'reportMonth' to the report month
4. Update metro-level stats from the main report
5. Update area stats by searching '[City] Ohio median home price [month] [year]'

dataFields.medianPrice: Median sale price for the month
dataFields.avgDaysOnMarket: Average days homes stay on market before pending
dataFields.activeListings: Number of homes currently for sale
dataFields.closedSales: Number of homes sold in the month
dataFields.pricePerSqFt: Median price per square foot (if available)
